org.codemonkey.util
Interface SimpleSerialization<T>

Type Parameters:
T - The type of object produced by deserialize(String).
public interface SimpleSerialization<T>

Guarantees an object can produce and populate itself with a string value, not unlike deserialization.

This class is like Serializable except it's a much simpler version where the object itself provides the serialization code.

Since:
1.0
Author:
Benny Bottema
See Also:
deserialize(String)

Method Summary
 T deserialize(String value)
          The general contract of deserialize is:
Instance T a equals T b where b = new T().deserialize(a.serialize()).
 String serialize()
          Makes the object convert itself to a string representation.
 

Method Detail

serialize

String serialize()
Makes the object convert itself to a string representation.

Returns:
A String representation of the current Object that can be used to recreate an instance of the same type using deserialize(String).

deserialize

T deserialize(String value)
The general contract of deserialize is:
Instance T a equals T b where b = new T().deserialize(a.serialize()).

Parameters:
value - A String value as produced by serialize().
Returns:
A populated Object from a String produced by serialize().
